alert.note: Alert for Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 8:38AM MST until January 12 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.For the Wind Chill Warning, extreme cold expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. * WHERE...Highway 83 Seeley Lake to Condon, I-90 East Missoula to Bearmouth, and Highway 200 Bonner to Greenough. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
